hijbul alam schrieb:
> Dear Mr. Christian Krumm 
> 
> Hello
> Thanks for important clarification about Ordinal no. 
> I dont know sending PM is ok.  please let me know whether i will send this email in group.

Sending PM is ok. But I think it whould be even better, if the emails
whould be send to the list, so other researchers may comment it or use
it for their proposes.

> Perhaps i have read some where about it but dont understand or dont pay attention.
> I include my writer processor in post processor chain. now i get usable link ( i.e i get rid of   L a/@href   such kind of thing..(http://www.mit. edu/research/ name/index. html L a/@href) )
> I would be very happy if you share   IdProcessor code please.

Well I put my Writer in the write processor chain, after the
LinkExtractor, so only the URIs whould be inserted, which may be
fetched. this way there won't be deadlinks in the db.

I've attached the Code to this Email. The code for fetching the MAX
DocumentID from Database has to be added by you in the DatabaseFacade.
The code is for heritrix2, so you have to backport it yourself when
using heritrix 1.x.

Christian

> Will it work for multimachine crawler?

Well, I haven't tested this,
but let me know if it works.

> Best regards
> HIJBUL



> ----- Original Message ----
> From: Christian Krumm <signore.chrissi@...>
> To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Friday, July 4, 2008 5:11:38 AM
> Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Ordinal no- discover URI
> 
> 
> Hello,
> 
> as far as I know, the ordinal would not be setted when extracting the
> hyperlink, but when the referenced ressource whould be downloaded or
> fetched by heritrix. The ordinal is for identifying a CrawlURI within a
> running job, but you can't use it for persitent storage, because it
> would be resetted for each job you run.
> 
> If you need an unique number for using it as an identifier for
> persitence storage, you have to set one on your own. I've written an
> IdProcessor for my proposes which assigns an unique long to each fetched
> CrawlURI using an AtomicLong. I may share the code, if you whould like
> to have a look on it.
> 
> On your problem on how to detect "valid" Hyperlinks, I whould suggest to
> use DecideRules as Midfetch-Filter. You may even reject outlinks which
> has an .jpg or .gif file-ending, which shall work for 99,99% of the
> cases. But actually you can't be sure if it is really an image, when you
> haven't fetched the ressource.
> 
> Hope this helps
> Christian
> 
> hijbul alam schrieb:
>> Hello
>> Is there any unique number/ordinal for discover URI/candidate URI.?
>> I got the outlinks of CrawlUri by Curi.getoutlinks( );
>> How can i get the unique/ordinal no of this newly discovered outlinks?
>> CrawlURI.getoutlink s() extract some invalid link such link to gif file.
>> http://www.mit. edu/img/n. gif E img/@src
>> http://www.mit. edu/img/n. gif E img/@src
>> http://www.mit. edu/research/ name/index. html L a/@href
>> http://web.mit. edu/img/n. gif E img/@src
>> http://web.mit. edu/humanistic/ www/ L a/@href
>> http://www.mit. edu/img/n. gif E img/@src
>> http://www.mit. edu/research/ name/r.html L a/@href
>> How can I detect valid Link using heritrix module?
>> Thanks in Advance
>> HIJBUL
>> N:B: I am using a Writer proceesor to store the Link stucture in MSSQL database
>>
>>
>>
> 
>  
> 
> 
>
